alert.note: Alert for Baker; Decatur; Dougherty; Early; Grady; Miller; Mitchell; Seminole (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 22 at 1:21PM EDT until July 22 at 2:15PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Decatur County in southwestern Georgia... Northwestern Grady County in southwestern Georgia... Miller County in southwestern Georgia... Southwestern Dougherty County in southwestern Georgia... Southern Mitchell County in southwestern Georgia... Baker County in southwestern Georgia... Central Early County in southwestern Georgia... Northeastern Seminole County in southwestern Georgia... * Until 215 PM EDT. * At 121 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Newton to 9 miles north of Donalsonville, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Colquitt, Newton, Donalsonville, Pelham, Camilla, Douglasville, Centerville, Iron City, Damascus, Brinson, Ausmac, Babcock, Iveys Mill, Little Hope, Mayhaw, Decatur Co A/P, Harrells Still, Boykin, Mimsville and Sharphagen. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Baker; Decatur; Dougherty; Early; Grady; Miller; Mitchell; Seminole
